bug.author: seewpx
bug.summary: Pytorch compilation is terminated on Gentoo for security reason
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>‚ùì Questions and Help</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>[937/2456] Generating ../aten/src/ATen/CPUType.cpp, ../aten/src/ATen/CPUType.h, ../aten/src/ATen/Declarations.yaml, ../aten/src/ATen/ExtensionBackendRegistration.h, ../aten/src/ATen/Functions.h, ../aten/src/ATen/LegacyTHFunctionsCPU.cpp, ../aten/src/ATen/LegacyTHFunctionsCPU.h, ../aten/src/ATen/MSNPUType.cpp, ../aten/src/ATen/MSNPUType.h, ../aten/src/ATen/MkldnnCPUType.cpp, ../aten/src/ATen/MkldnnCPUType.h, ../aten/src/ATen/NativeFunctions.h, ../aten/src/ATen/QuantizedCPUType.cpp, ../aten/src/ATen/QuantizedCPUType.h, ../aten/src/ATen/RegistrationDeclarations.h, ../aten/src/ATen/SparseCPUType.cpp, ../aten/src/ATen/SparseCPUType.h, ../aten/src/ATen/TypeDefault.cpp, ../aten/src/ATen/TypeDefault.h, ../aten/src/ATen/XLAType.cpp, ../aten/src/ATen/XLAType.h, ../aten/src/ATen/CUDAType.cpp, ../aten/src/ATen/CUDAType.h, ../aten/src/ATen/LegacyTHFunctionsCUDA.cpp, ../aten/src/ATen/LegacyTHFunctionsCUDA.h, ../aten/src/ATen/SparseCUDAType.cpp, ../aten/src/ATen/SparseCUDAType.h FAILED: aten/src/ATen/CPUType.cpp aten/src/ATen/CPUType.h aten/src/ATen/Declarations.yaml aten/src/ATen/ExtensionBackendRegistration.h aten/src/ATen/Functions.h aten/src/ATen/LegacyTHFunctionsCPU.cpp aten/src/ATen/LegacyTHFunctionsCPU.h aten/src/ATen/MSNPUType.cpp aten/src/ATen/MSNPUType.h aten/src/ATen/MkldnnCPUType.cpp aten/src/ATen/MkldnnCPUType.h aten/src/ATen/NativeFunctions.h aten/src/ATen/QuantizedCPUType.cpp aten/src/ATen/QuantizedCPUType.h aten/src/ATen/RegistrationDeclarations.h aten/src/ATen/SparseCPUType.cpp aten/src/ATen/SparseCPUType.h aten/src/ATen/TypeDefault.cpp aten/src/ATen/TypeDefault.h aten/src/ATen/XLAType.cpp aten/src/ATen/XLAType.h aten/src/ATen/CUDAType.cpp aten/src/ATen/CUDAType.h aten/src/ATen/LegacyTHFunctionsCUDA.cpp aten/src/ATen/LegacyTHFunctionsCUDA.h aten/src/ATen/SparseCUDAType.cpp aten/src/ATen/SparseCUDAType.h cd /var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/build/caffe2 && /usr/bin/python3.6 /var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/cmake/../aten/src/ATen/gen.py --source-path /var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/cmake/../aten/src/ATen --install_dir /var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/build/aten/src/ATen /var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/cmake/../aten/src/ATen/Declarations.cwrap /var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/cmake/../aten/src/THNN/generic/THNN.h /var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/cmake/../aten/src/THCUNN/generic/THCUNN.h /var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/cmake/../aten/src/ATen/nn.yaml /var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/cmake/../aten/src/ATen/native/native_functions.yaml Traceback (most recent call last): File "/var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/cmake/../aten/src/ATen/gen.py", line 494, in <module> generate_outputs() File "/var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/cmake/../aten/src/ATen/gen.py", line 425, in generate_outputs for file in cwrap_files File "/var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/cmake/../aten/src/ATen/gen.py", line 426, in <listcomp> for d in cwrap_parser.parse(file)] File "/var/tmp/portage/sci-libs/pytorch-9999/work/pytorch-9999/aten/src/ATen/cwrap_parser.py", line 18, in parse declaration = yaml.load('\n'.join(declaration_lines)) File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/yaml/__init__.py", line 109, in load raise RuntimeError("Unsafe load() call disabled by Gentoo. See bug #659348") RuntimeError: Unsafe load() call disabled by Gentoo. See bug #659348 </denchmark-code>
The pyyaml's load() call Pytorch use is considered unsafe in Gentoo. Any load() call will raise error. What should I do to avoid this error? ##This is the Gentoo develop team's disccusion <denchmark-link:https://bugs.gentoo.org/659348>https://bugs.gentoo.org/659348</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Please note that this issue tracker is not a help form and this issue will be closed.</denchmark-h>
We have a set of <denchmark-link:https://pytorch.org/resources>listed resources available on the website</denchmark-link> . Our primary means of support is our discussion forum:
Discussion Forum

comments.comment:
<denchmark-code>diff --git a/aten/src/ATen/cwrap_parser.py b/aten/src/ATen/cwrap_parser.py index f020dd030..32b4957c9 100644 --- a/aten/src/ATen/cwrap_parser.py +++ b/aten/src/ATen/cwrap_parser.py @@ -15,7 +15,7 @@ def parse(filename): in_declaration = True elif line == ']]': in_declaration = False - declaration = yaml.load('
'.join(declaration_lines)) + declaration = yaml.safe_load('
'.join(declaration_lines)) declarations.append(declaration) elif in_declaration: declaration_lines.append(line) diff --git a/tools/cwrap/cwrap.py b/tools/cwrap/cwrap.py index 5954fb817..c68e8f4d8 100644 --- a/tools/cwrap/cwrap.py +++ b/tools/cwrap/cwrap.py @@ -88,7 +88,7 @@ class cwrap(object): in_declaration = True elif line == ']]': in_declaration = False - declaration = yaml.load('
'.join(declaration_lines)) + declaration = yaml.safe_load('
'.join(declaration_lines)) cwrap_common.set_declaration_defaults(declaration)
# Pass declaration in a list - maybe some plugins want to add </denchmark-code>
Based on the bug report, I think the issue would be resolved if you update to a more recent version of PyYAML.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/vishwakftw>@vishwakftw</denchmark-link> Yet the newest version 5.1.1 of PyYAML compared version 5.1 of mine have not any change at this place. But I have patched the code to avoid above error. Thank you!
